titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Its Hiniker (James J.) and Hale (Sandra J.) Files at the Minnesota Historical Society
titlestmt.sponsor: National Historical Publications and Records Commission.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Cheri Thies, February 2012.

did.head: OVERVIEW

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Minnesota. Dept. of Administration. Commissioner's Office.

did.unittitle: Hiniker (James J.) and Hale (Sandra J.) files.
did.abstract: Files of Commissioners James J. Hiniker (1979-1983) and Sandra J. Hale (1983-1991).
did.physdesc: 19.7 cu. ft. (20 boxes and 1 partial box).
did.physloc: See Detailed Description for shelf locations.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENTS
scopecontent.p: The chronological files contain copies of outgoing letters, memoranda, and related materials mainly with other departmental personnel, state and local officials, legislators, and the general public. They deal with a variety of topics concerning the department's responsibility for the day to day management of the executive branch of state government, including personnel matters, legislation, the management of state land and institutions, and the construction and maintenance of state buildings. The letters in Hiniker's files are numbered sequentially. Hale's files include an alphabetical index.

The Hiniker/Hale subject files focus on the operations of the department's building code, building construction, energy conservation, management analysis, motor pool, organization and methods, personnel, plant management, printing and mailing services, telecommunications, procurement, and real estate management divisions, information services bureau, and data privacy unit, as well as relations with the departments of employee relations, finance, public welfare, and transportation, the governor's office, and various state correctional and educational institutions. They also contain staff meeting minutes and work plans.

The Hale subject files cover many of the issues and relationships found in the previous set, along with such topics as handicapped persons, the Minnesota History Center, materials management, and the Strive Toward Excellence in Performance [STEP] program, and relations with the Capitol Area Architectural and Planning Board, Governor's Residence Council, Loaned Executive Action Program, Minnesota Veterans' Home, the Energy and Economic Development Department, Legislative Auditor, Office of Volunteer Services, and State Arts Board. There are also copies of her speeches and files documenting her Executive Council service and post-commissioner work with Enterprise Management International.

arrangement.head: ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: The chronological files are arranged first by correspondent; thereunder chronologically.
These documents are arranged into the following sections:

controlaccess.head: CATALOG HEADINGS
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the catalog of the Minnesota Historical Society. Researchers desiring materials about related topics should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.head: Organizations:
controlaccess.corpname: Minnesota. Dept. of Administration. Information Services Bureau.
Minnesota. Capitol Area Architectural and Planning Board.
Minnesota. Dept. of Energy and Economic Development.
Minnesota. Governor's Loaned Executives Action Program.
Minnesota. Legislature. Office of the Legislative Auditor.
Strive Toward Excellence in Performance (Program : Minn.).

processinfo.head: Processing Information:
processinfo.p: Processing and cataloging of this collection was supported with a Basic Project grant awarded by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC).

scopecontent.p: Program and preliminary schematic design study.

Copeland, William C.: Refinancing and Reorganizing Human Services: Inter-Agency Net Budgeting and Other Fiscal Incentives,

scopecontent.p: Includes conference and seminar outlines and materials, strategic planning, correspondence, brochures, and newsletters relating to her work as Commissioner and with the State Arts Board and Enterprise Management, International.
Includes action plans, statement of values, current projects, mission statements and office memorandum.
Includes professional accomplishments, employment history, resumes, references, and certificates of awards.

did.unittitle: Blue Ribbon Committee on Information Policies,
CAAPB [Capitol Area Architectural and Planning Board],

scopecontent.p: Correspondence sent and received to government officials, private businesses, nonprofit administrators, general public and personal congratulatory notes.

did.unittitle: Defining the Elephant (Strategic Management Plan for 1989-1990),

scopecontent.p: Approved and closed cases, background material, and list reports.
Includes newspaper and newsletter clippings related to Commissioner Hale and the Administration Department and her various community roles.
Photographs of Commissioner Hale and unidentified persons.
Various magazine and journal publications which include an article written by or about Sandra Hale.
Speeches given nationally and internationally as Commissioner and as President of Enterprise Management at conferences, seminars and commencements.

did.unittitle: State Hospital System, The Future of,

scopecontent.p: STEP, a tool for improving the quality, quantity and cost effectiveness of state government services, was launched in the spring of 1985 by Governor Perpich and ended in 1991 when Governor Carlson created the Commission on Reform and Efficiency [CORE]. Included are STEP hypotheses, projects, program highlights, newsletter and newspaper clippings.
